relation: I believe everyone gets a scholarship If accepted. The school is more than generous with scholarship funds.

The food could improve, and is in the process of improving in the dining hall. The 3 cafe's on campus are excellent and offer diverse and better quality choices. Surrounding groceries provide healthy alternatives
Dorm life is what you make of it. Facilities are clean and maintence is fast if assistance is ever needed. Dorms, apartments, and villas are available to students.
Some professors are excellent, others are less talented. Your education is what you make of it. Tons of FREE, yes I did say FREE tutoring is available.

Apply & pay your deposits early to get good housing (not in the hotel). Use your many resources available, ask for help when struggling, and make a good relationship with your professors. Professors here will spend lots of extra time and do everything they can to help you pass and succeed.

Barry is diverse with students from different tax brackets, ethnicities, and counties. The weather and scenery is beautiful. Students and professors are down to earth and friendly, it's very easy to make friends.
pageTitle: Barry University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

Make sure that you know deadlines for payments and the changes made to your account 3. Park in areas that you can park, otherwise your car will be towed and you will get a ticket. 4. Join an organization or more, and be involved. 5. Most resident Halls are not that bad, just remember its an old university but in Fall 2012, there will be a new resident hall & if you can apply to live in the houses around campus. 6. If you are not Catholic, Barry doesn't mind they will accept anyway. 7. Focus on your studies, the better that you do the more that will shine. 8. Moonlight Madness is one of the most sporting events that the school hosts., 146762=It's expensive because it's a private university, but the classes are smaller which is better for 1:1 time. I think it's worth the money., 409028=© 2015, Cappex.com, LLC, 29180=The food here is AMAZING for about the first four months, then you get sick of it. I stopped eating at the WOW by about January and started eating at the BUC stop, which can be pricey. So i stocked up on lots of snacks, noodles, mac n cheese, and it worked out. I didn't even like walking to the student union to eat so the snacks worked out well., 273001=If you are looking for a party school, Barry is not for you. The teacher student ratio is about 1:20. Beautiful and peaceful campus with people who truly cares about your success here at Barry., 259913=The University is catholic based and it was founded in 1940, it was all girls then, it became co ed in 1960, there are a lot of old buildings and structures around. There are foxes on campus, Yes Foxes!}

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students For students wanting to be in the medical field, broadcasting field, arts, or business field. For students that like to network, and meet people from all over. For students that want to be part of a community, who really want to belong. For students that really like extracurricular activities, like those in the entertainment field. For students that like to work hard. For students that like to have fun. For students who want to be great. For students who want their dreams to become a reality. Tips for prospective students Be prepared to have a lot of fun because the school has a lot of extracurricular activities to do, whether it be intramural sports, modeling, modern dancing, or trying out for the step team. Also go to class everyday, do your work on time, and essays ahead of time so you won't really have to worry about finals, and to party. Bang for the buck The school is pretty expensive yet the food in the cafeteria could be much better, by having more variety and being cooked more better.
